ygData.subject: Work
ygData.msgSnippet: The the orange ball set in the west, the soon to be members of the Neo Decepticon Empire went to work once agian. With a full moon and several large lamp posts

--part1_a8.12a55c4b.27e77e31_boundary
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="US-ASCII"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

       The the orange ball set in the west, the soon to be members of the Neo 
Decepticon Empire went to work once agian. With a full moon and several large 
lamp posts as there light, the mining area was visible and secure.
       "Hell Beast, we've found the computer core. Its deep though. were 
going to have to blast." Tarantulas rhasped to his commander, while holding a 
scanning pad showing the location of the core.
       Hell Beast gave his authorization. The Predacons quickly set to work 
placing explosives and connecting fuses. Within an hour the blast componenets 
were complete.
       A loud crack sounded the first series of erruptions of the blasts, 
followed by several smaller explosions. When the smoke cleared a gaping hole 
led them down into the ground where a portion of the ship had sunk.
       Inside it appeared to be frozen in time. Everything looked as if it 
hadnt been moved at all. This section of the ship was most likely made blast 
prof by the investors, for safety. Tarantulas quickly had the core lifted 
from the hole and set on a trailer pulled by Tankkor.
       "Excellent work. Lets head back now and get some rest." Hell Beast 
ordered as he boarded the troop transport. The troops follwed and the lights 
power was cut. The mining operation was lit shortly by the red glow of the 
jet thrusts, but they faded and the site was in darkness once more.

      Ominous Prime watched them go. The Neo Decepticon Empire was stealing 
materials....important materials. He needed to find out why. And was this 
cause worth joining?
       The Energonians were never going to be able to destroy all the 
transformers on this planet. Not without altering history forever. As much as 
Ominous hated to admit it, his small faction was going to have to join some 
big faction or slowly dwindle into nothingness.
       A meeting needed to be arranged, and soon.

       Mortem wandered around Allience Island with Tal-X close in pursuit, 
inside his tech skeleton body. The flora of the island was very welcoming to 
a bot who had spent a month en route to this planet.
       "When will we see Zardus?" Tal asked, his electric face bouncing on a 
digital screen.
       Mortem didnt know. They walked inside the Iron Fist, and proceeded 
down a large corridor. "I think the bridge is this way. he should be there." 
Then she stopped. "But I doubt we would even make it that far with security."
       She sent a message to Zardus to meet them soon, somewhere in this 
labrynth of a ship.

--part1_a8.12a55c4b.27e77e31_boundary
